nodes.documentation:
@dev The following duplicates are not necessary for deploying BTCGateway or
 ZECGateway contracts, but are used to track deployments.
nodes.name: BTCGateway

params._amount: The amount of the token being burnt, in its        smallest value. (e.g. satoshis for BTC)
params._to: The address to receive the un-bridged asset. The format of        this address should be of the destination chain.        For example, when burning to Bitcoin, _to should be a        Bitcoin address.

params._burnFee: The amount subtracted each burn request and        forwarded to the feeRecipient. In BIPS.
params._feeRecipient: The recipient of burning and minting fees.
params._mintAuthority: The address of the key that can sign mint        requests.
params._mintFee: The amount subtracted each mint request and        forwarded to the feeRecipient. In BIPS.
params._token: The RenERC20 this Gateway is responsible for.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

params._amountUnderlying: The amount of the token being minted, in its smallest        value. (e.g. satoshis for BTC).
params._nHash: (nonce hash) The hash of the nonce, amount and pHash.
params._pHash: (payload hash) The hash of the payload associated with the        mint.
params._sig: The signature of the hash of the following values:        (pHash, amount, msg.sender, nHash), signed by the mintAuthority.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._nextBurnFee: The new fee for minting and burning.

params._nextFeeRecipient: The address to start paying fees to.

params._nextMintAuthority: The address to start paying fees to.

params._nextMintFee: The new fee for minting and burning.

burn(bytes,uint256).notice: burn destroys tokens after taking a fee for the `_feeRecipient`,         allowing the associated assets to be released on their native         chain.

claimTokenOwnership().notice: Claims ownership of the token passed in to the constructor. `transferStoreOwnership` must have previously been called. Anyone can call this function.

hashForSignature(bytes32,uint256,address.notice: hashForSignature hashes the parameters so that they can be signed.

mint(bytes32,uint256,bytes32,bytes).notice: mint verifies a mint approval signature from RenVM and creates         tokens after taking a fee for the `_feeRecipient`.

recoverTokens(address).notice: Allow the owner of the contract to recover funds accidentally sent to the contract. To withdraw ETH, the token should be set to `0x0`.

transferTokenOwnership(address).notice: Allow the owner to update the owner of the RenERC20 token.

updateBurnFee(uint16).notice: Allow the owner to update the burn fee.

updateFeeRecipient(address).notice: Allow the owner to update the fee recipient.

updateMinimumBurnAmount(uint256).notice: Allow the owner to update the minimum burn amount.

updateMintAuthority(address).notice: Allow the owner to update the fee recipient.

updateMintFee(uint16).notice: Allow the owner to update the 'mint' fee.

verifySignature(bytes32,bytes).notice: verifySignature checks the the provided signature matches the provided parameters.

userdoc.notice: Gateway handles verifying mint and burn requests. A mintAuthority approves new assets to be minted by providing a digital signature. An owner of an asset can request for it to be burnt.
